rev.comment: /* 4 February â Friday of Departure */ fixed sources
rev.diff:
Line 258: Line 258:
During the night of 3â4 February, there were tanks on the street in Cairo as many of the protesters again spent the night in Tahrir Square. Pro-government protesters were also active and small-scale clashes happened in the early hours.<ref name="aljazlive"/>
During the night of 3â4 February, there were tanks on the street in Cairo as many of the protesters again spent the night in Tahrir Square. Pro-government protesters were also active and small-scale clashes happened in the early hours.<ref name="aljazlive"/>
â
Hundreds of thousands gathered to participate in Friday day prayer in Tahrir Square.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.net/node/3164 |title=Live blog Feb 4 - Egypt protests | Al Jazeera Blogs |publisher=Blogs.aljazeera.net |date= |accessdate=2011-02-05}}</ref> [[Egyptian Christians]] and others not performing Friday prayers formed a "human chain" around those praying to protect them from any potential disruptions.<ref name="aljazlive"/> The day's planned events began after Friday prayers. Al Jazeera estimated the crowd size to be over a million in Tahrir Square.<ref>[http://www.demotix.com/news/579902/flags-egypt-raised-above-tahrir-square "Flags of Egypt raised above Tahrir Square"] ''Demotix - News By You'' - Retrieved 4 February 2011.</ref> Mohammed ElBaradei was also in attendance. Protesters held portraits of former presidents [[Gamal Abdel Nasser]] and [[Anwar Sadat]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hindu.com/2011/02/05/stories/2011020565420100.htm |title=Front Page : Ball in Mubarak's court as democracy pressure mounts |publisher=The Hindu |date= |accessdate=2011-02-05}}</ref> However, protesters did not get to the presidential palace. In Alexandria, over a million protesterts turned out, making it the biggest ever protest in Alexandria. They warned that if the government used violence against protesters in Cairo, they would march to Cairo to join the protesters there.<ref name="aljazlive"/>
+
Two million Egyptians flooded Tahrir Square to participate in Friday day prayer in Tahrir Square.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tehrantimes.com/index_View.asp?code=235172|title=2 million Egyptians turn out for Day of Departure|publisher=[[Tehran Times]]|date=2011-02-05|accessdate=2011-02-05}}</ref> [[Egyptian Christians]] and others not performing Friday prayers formed a "human chain" around those praying to protect them from any potential disruptions.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://andrewsullivan.theatlantic.com/the_daily_dish/2011/02/the-day-of-departure-its-either-death-or-freedom.html|author=Chris Bodenner|title="The Day Of Departure": Calm But Determined|publisher=The Atlantic|accessdate=}}</ref> The day's planned events began after Friday prayers. Al Jazeera estimated the crowd size to be over a million in Tahrir Square.<ref>[http://www.demotix.com/news/579902/flags-egypt-raised-above-tahrir-square "Flags of Egypt raised above Tahrir Square"] ''Demotix - News By You'' - Retrieved 4 February 2011.</ref> Mohammed ElBaradei was also in attendance. Protesters held portraits of former presidents [[Gamal Abdel Nasser]] and [[Anwar Sadat]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hindu.com/2011/02/05/stories/2011020565420100.htm |title=Front Page : Ball in Mubarak's court as democracy pressure mounts |publisher=The Hindu |date= |accessdate=2011-02-05}}</ref> However, protesters did not get to the presidential palace. In Alexandria, over a million protesterts turned out, making it the biggest ever protest in Alexandria. They warned that if the government used violence against protesters in Cairo, they would march to Cairo to join the protesters there.<ref name="aljazlive"/>
Protest marches were also held in Giza and [[El-Mahalla El-Kubra]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/02/201124175331299951.html |title=Egypt holds 'Day of Departure' - Middle East |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date= |accessdate=2011-02-05}}</ref> Suez, [[Port Said]], [[Rafah, Egypt |Rafah]], [[IsmaÃ¯lia|Ismailiya]], [[Zagazig]], [[El-Mahalla El-Kubra|al-Mahalla al-Kubra]], [[Aswan]] and [[Asyut]].<ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-12371479 Obama seeks quick Egypt handover], BBC News, 5 Feb 2011</ref>
Protest marches were also held in Giza and [[El-Mahalla El-Kubra]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/02/201124175331299951.html |title=Egypt holds 'Day of Departure' - Middle East |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date= |accessdate=2011-02-05}}</ref> Suez, [[Port Said]], [[Rafah, Egypt |Rafah]], [[IsmaÃ¯lia|Ismailiya]], [[Zagazig]], [[El-Mahalla El-Kubra|al-Mahalla al-Kubra]], [[Aswan]] and [[Asyut]].<ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-12371479 Obama seeks quick Egypt handover], BBC News, 5 Feb 2011</ref>
